intro: Angelica scabrida, commonly known as rough angelica, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Angelica scabrida is known for its aromatic roots and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and can grow up to two meters in height.
